Title: Object: République [costume sous]
Series: Suite de dessins a la plume 1839
Description: Plate no 30, soldier in the costume of the French Republic seen in profile; the scene is set in Egypt with pyramids in the background and palm leaves in the mid-ground. 1839 Pen Lithograph.
Producer name: Print made by: Nicolas Toussaint Charlet
Curator's comments: La Combe mentions a rare unfinished early design for this lithograph (See La Combe 1032). This is not included in the collection.

Part of an album published by Gihaut frères in 1839 for use of students of the "École spéciales des ponts et chausées" of Metz, produced by Charlet in his capacity as a teacher of drawing at the École Royale Polytechnique. The drawings are in their original wrapper which incorporates cover illustration by Charlet, see 1852, 0424.202
Bibliographic references: La Combe 1856 / Charlet, sa vie, ses lettres, suivi d'une description raisonné de son oeuvre lithographique (1031)
